{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3583897,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T16:24:24.787Z","cooked":"

The PS5 DualShock controllers offer many more features (that I am exploring how to use) than are usable with the standard driver station communication. Examples include advanced haptic feedback, adaptive triggers, light bar, and more.

I am searching for ways to use these features and have a couple of ideas:

  1. A Python script that listens to some NetworkTables values; then, when haptic feedback is requested, the NetworkTables values change, and the script sends the proper commands to the controller.

  2. A Python script that takes data from the controller and sends it to NetworkTables, as well as listening to NetworkTables for feedback; then, all data on the robot code side is sent and received from NetworkTables.

Do you have a better way of implementing these features? I am currently leaning towards the first method because it is much less risky.
